events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a one-year extension of the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA).

facts.fact_text: President Donald Trump signed a one-year extension of the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) into law.

evidences.evidence_text: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday signed into law a one-year extension of the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA)

facts.fact_text: The AGOA extension runs through December 31 and is applied retroactively from September 30, 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: running through December 31 and applied retroactively from September 30, 2025

facts.fact_text: AGOA allows qualifying countries to export more than 1,800 products to the U.S. without tariffs.

evidences.evidence_text: AGOA allows qualifying countries to export more than 1,800 products to the United States without tariffs

claims.claim_text: The AGOA program supports trade, investment, and employment across the Sub-Saharan African region.
claims.author: Jamieson Greer

evidences.evidence_text: supporting trade, investment, and employment across the region.

evidence.evidence_text: supporting trade, investment, and employment across the region.
supporting trade, investment, and employment across the region.
